data.event: It was incorporated in 1910 and is named in honour of Benjamin Disraeli, Lord Beaconsfield, Prime Minister of the United Kingdom in the 1860s and 1870s and close confidant of Queen Victoria.

event.title: was merged into the city of Montreal on January 1, 2002

data.event: As part of the 2002–2006 municipal reorganization of Montreal, Beaconsfield was merged into the city of Montreal on January 1, 2002, joining with neighbouring Baie-D'Urfé to create the borough of Beaconsfield–Baie-D'Urfé.

event.title: were reconstituted as independent cities on January 1, 2006

data.event: After a change of government and a 2004 referendum, both of them voted to demerge and were reconstituted as independent cities on January 1, 2006.
